p: During the 1970s, additional clinical features were described for children and infants with CHIKF ( Table 1). The 1974 CHIKV epidemic in Ibadan, Nigeria was caused by the West African genotype and was described as a febrile illness with rash and joint pain from which all children recovered [ 26, 27]. During 1970â€“1972, CHIKV of Asian lineage caused hemorrhagic fever epidemics in children in Burma. The symptoms reported were indistinguishable from dengue and most infected individuals also presented with similar pulmonary hemorrhagic symptoms as Influenza A and B, which were also circulating at the time [ 9, 10, 25, 28].
